required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dry Needling for Shoulder Pain in Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Dry Needling for Shoulder Pain and Presence of Post-needling Induced-Pain in PAtients Who Had Suffered a Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: Spasticity and pain, particularly int he shoulder region, are the most common impairments experienced by subjects who had experienced a stroke. There is preliminary evidence supporting the role of dry needling for spasticity in patients who had suffered from a stroke. Few data exists on the effects on shoulder pain. In addition, it has been shown that application of dry needling induces post-needling soreness in individuals with musculoskeletal pain. No previous study has investigated the presence and the duration of post-needling soreness in individuals who had experienced a stroke.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in post-dry needling pain intensity with a numerical pain rate scale before and after the intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24 hours (1 day) after and 72 hours (3 days) after treatment the intervention
primary_outcome.description: A Numerical Pain Rate Scale (NPRS, 0-10) will be used to record post-dry needling soreness in the targeted area

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in spontaneous shoulder pain with a numerical pain rate scale before and after the intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 72 hours (3 days) and 168 hours (7 days) after treatment the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: A Numerical Pain Rate Scale (NPRS, 0-10) will be used to assess spontaneous shoulder pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of active trigger points in the shoulder musculature
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 72 hours (3 days) and 168 hours (7 days) after treatment the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Manual palpation of active trigger points in the shoulder muscles will be conducted

arm_group.description: The experimental group will receive a single session of modulatory interventions combined with a single session of dry needling into the shoulder muscles which active trigger points will reproduce the shoulder pain symptoms.
This group will receive a single session of modulatory interventions targeting modulation of central nervous system.

intervention.description: A single session of modulatory interventions combined with a single session of dry needling into the shoulder muscles which active trigger points will reproduce the shoulder pain symptoms.
A single session of modulatory interventions targeting modulation of central nervous system.
